subject: Re: [junit] Using Sorter
msgSnippet: ... I m so glad you re able to make such strong statements about products you barely know. Good luck. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your
messageBody:
Federico Vela wrote:

> I actually changed my mind, I am now working with TestNG.
>
> My initial choice was TestNG but I was pulled by Junitâ€™s large user base +
> docs.
>
> However, Junit is too inflexible and cumbersome.
>

> in maven 2.
>
> Anyway thank you for replying.
>
> TestNG rulez!!!

I'm so glad you're able to make such strong statements about products
you barely know. Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
